text: Brickellia oligadena is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to western Mexico, the states of Michoacán, Colima, Guerrero, and Jalisco.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272 Brickellia oligadena is a shrub sometimes growing up to 3 meters (10 feet) tall.Blake, Sydney Fay 1926. Contributions from the United States National Herbarium 23(5): 1481-1482 as Coleosanthus squarrosus var. oligadenusTurner, Billie Lee 1990.
